jutils

Class Args

  • java.lang.Object
    • jutils.Args

  • public class Args
extends java.lang.Object
    The Args class maintains the list of valid command line arguments for a program, as well as the parsing and storing the values of the arguments for access by the rest of the program. This is done centrally so that programs can parse all the arguments once and then simply access their values, and even verify if an argument has been passed. When an argument is defined, a default value will be defined so that if the argument is not passed, these a value can be inferred. 14.65 Updated newDefault to allow changing of default after params have been parsed

    • Method Detail

      • getErrs

        public Errs getErrs()
        Returns the most recent error information
        Returns:
        Errs class containing the most recent error information

      • passed

        public boolean passed(java.lang.String param)
        Returns a boolean flag indicating if the argument was passed to the program or not. No checking if the parm has a required value or is valid, only if it was passed or not.
        Parameters:
        param - string of the argument to check
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if the argument was passed to the program.

      • title

        public java.lang.String title(java.lang.String param)
        Returns the string value of the title or "Nice Name" of the argument
        Parameters:
        param - string of the argument
        Returns:
        String "Nice Name" of the argument, or an empty string if the argument is not defined

      • type

        public java.lang.String type(java.lang.String param)
        Returns a string value indicating the "type" for the specific argument.
        Parameters:
        param - string of the argument to check
        Returns:
        String indicating the "type" of this argument

      • defineArg

        public boolean defineArg(java.lang.String param,
                         java.lang.String title,
                         java.lang.String type,
                         java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Creates an argument entry based on passed in values, no duplicates allowed.
        Parameters:
        param - string of the argument
        title - string of the argument's title or "Nice name"
        type - string of the argument's type
        defaultValue - string of the default value for the argument, may be converted internally based on the 'type'
        Returns:
        boolean indicating the command line parameter was defined correctly for this program

      • defineArg

        public boolean defineArg(java.lang.String param,
                         java.lang.String title,
                         java.lang.String type,
                         java.lang.String defaultValue,
                         java.lang.Boolean allowDups)
        Creates an argument entry based on passed in values, duplicates are optionally allowed if AllowDup is set to true
        Parameters:
        param - string of the argument
        title - string of the argument's title or "Nice name"
        type - string of the argument's type
        defaultValue - string of the default value for the argument, may be converted internally based on the 'type'
        allowDups - boolean indicating if duplicate parameters will override already defined arguments
        Returns:
        boolean indicating the command line parameter was defined correctly for this program

      • newDefault

        public boolean newDefault(java.lang.String param,
                          java.lang.String defaultValue)

      • parseArgs

        public boolean parseArgs(java.lang.String[] clArgs)
        Extracts command line arguments and map them into a HashMap of Argument Details for easier processing by the program. Argument values are stored both as the their string values, and the actual values based on a declared "type" for the argument.

        The method parses the entire command line argument line and reports all of the errors it finds.

        Parameters:
        clArgs - String array of command line arguments
        Returns:
        boolean value true if command line arguments parsed with no errors, otherwise false

      • infoShow

        public void infoShow(java.lang.String title,
                     java.util.List<java.lang.String> ARGFields)
        Prints out the Argument fields onto System.out. For debugging or verbose output.
        Parameters:
        title - string title to be printed
        ARGFields - List of Strings of Argument fields to be printed

      • getS

        public java.lang.String getS(java.lang.String argParam)
        Returns the string value of the argument requested
        Parameters:
        argParam - string of the argument type to return
        Returns:
        string value of the argument (or default if none passed);

      • getB

        public java.lang.Boolean getB(java.lang.String argParam)
        Returns the boolean value of a boolean argument. If a non boolean argument is passed, an error is set. However the method returns true if it passed to the program, otherwise false.
        Parameters:
        argParam - string of the boolean argument to return
        Returns:
        boolean value indicating if argument was passed, true indicates it was passed, false indicates it was not passed

      • getF

        public boolean getF(java.lang.String argParam,
                    java.lang.String cFlag)
        Compares the Flag to the argument value to and returns true if they match. If the parameter type is not a flag, the comparison is still made, but a warning is returned.
        Parameters:
        argParam - string of the argument type to return
        cFlag - string value of flag value to match
        Returns:
        boolean true if CFlag matches the value of the argument otherwise false

      • getL

        public long getL(java.lang.String argParam)
        Returns the long value of the argument requested.

        Errors/Warnings:

        • If parameter type is not a long,
          • If the parameter was not passed, returns -2 and a warning
          • If parameter was passed, returns -1 and a warning
        • If not passed:
          • If default is defined, will return default value with a warning
          • if default is not defined, will return 0 with a warning
        Parameters:
        argParam - string of the argument type to return
        Returns:
        long value of the argument

      • getI

        public java.lang.Integer getI(java.lang.String argParam)
        Returns the Integer value of the argument requested.

        This calls the getL method and returns the result as an Integer See getL for full details

        Parameters:
        argParam - string of the argument type to return
        Returns:
        Integer value of the argument

      • getFL

        public float getFL(java.lang.String argParam)
        Returns the Float value of the argument requested, Sets an error if the parameter type is not Float and returns 0.0f
        Parameters:
        argParam - string of the argument type to return
        Returns:
        float value of the argument

      • getT

        @Deprecated
public java.lang.String getT(java.lang.String argParam)
        Deprecated. As of release 14.00, replaced by title()
        Returns the "Title" of the argument requested. Returns null if argument is not defined.
        Parameters:
        argParam - string of the argument type to return
        Returns:
        string value of the "Title" of the argument

      • getP

        @Deprecated
public boolean getP(java.lang.String argParam)
        Deprecated. As of release 14.00, replaced by passed()
        Returns the boolean value indicating if the parameter was passed in the list of arguments. Can be used for ANY type of argument
        Parameters:
        argParam - string of the argument to check
        Returns:
        boolean value indicating if argument was passed, true indicates it was passed, false indicates it was not passed, or an invalid argument was passed to this method

      • vaildParam

        public boolean vaildParam(java.lang.String argParam)
        Validates that the passed parameter is valid for this program
        Parameters:
        argParam - parameter to be validated
        Returns:
        boolean value indicating if argument was passed, true indicates it was passed, false indicates it was not passed

      • getVersion

        public static java.lang.String getVersion()
        Returns the version number of this class.
        Returns:
        string value of version number

      • getAllVersions

        public static java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAllVersions(java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> vlist)
        Returns list of mapped pairs of class file names and the version number. It also adds all called routines to the list. If the class file name and version is already in the list, it does not add them, it simply returns.
        Parameters:
        vlist - Map of the current class/versions to be appended to
        Returns:
        Map of the class/version values for this and all called routines
